intro: Oenothera mollissima var. grandiflora, commonly known as the woolly evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and showy yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant belongs to the Onagraceae family and is known for its nocturnal pollination by moths. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry, rocky habitats. The flowers emit a mild fragrance that attracts pollinators during the night.
